<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">35</font></div>

<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">ITEM 9A. CONTROLS AND </font>PROCEDURES</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">(a)</font>&#160; <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EVALUATION OF DISCLOSURE CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company carried out, under the supervision and with the participation of the Company's management, including the Company's Chief Executive Officer and the Company's Chief Financial Officer, an evaluation of the effectiveness of the design and operation of the Company's disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) under the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, as amended). &#160;Based on their evaluation, the Company's Chief Executive Officer and its Chief Financial Officer concluded that, as of June 30, 2016, the Company's disclosure controls and procedures were effective.&#160; Management has concluded that the consolidated financial statements in this Form 10-K fairly present, in all material respects, the Company's financial position, results of operations, comprehensive income (loss) and cash flows for the periods and dates presented.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">(b)</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;<font style="FONT-WEIGHT: bold">MANAGEMENT'S ANNUAL REPORT ON INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL REPORTING</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company's management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended). &#160;Our internal control over financial reporting is designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States. &#160;Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. &#160;Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 8pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 8pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 10pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">With the participation of the Company's Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, management conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting as of June 30, 2016, based on the framework and criteria established in <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Internal Control &#8211; Integrated Framework</font>, issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (2013).&#160; Management assessed the effectiveness of the Company's internal control over financial reporting as of June 30, 2016 and determined that the Company's controls and procedures were effective at the reasonable assurance level.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This annual report does not include an attestation report of the Company's independent registered public accounting firm regarding internal control over financial reporting. &#160;Management's report was not subject to attestation by the Company's independent registered public accounting firm pursuant to rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission that permit the Company to provide only management's report in this annual report.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt">
</div>

<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id="ec891e301c7a4c62bc4b1b169a3aebc4" class="DSPFListTable" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">(c)</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: auto; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CHANGES IN INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL REPORTING</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There were no changes in our internal control over financial reporting that occurred during our last fiscal quarter that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ITEM 9B. OTHER INFORMATION</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">None.</div>

<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">36</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</div>

<br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">PART III</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; TEXT-INDENT: -72pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 72pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ITEM 10.&#160; DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE OFFICERS, AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">John A. Carlson:<font style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font></font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mr. Carlson was appointed Chief Executive Officer of Alanco Technologies, Inc. in March 2014.&#160; Mr. Carlson joined the Company in September 1998 as Senior Vice President/Chief Financial Officer.&#160; Mr. Carlson started his career with Price Waterhouse &amp; Co. in Chicago, Illinois.&#160; He has over twenty-five years of public and private financial and operational management experience, including over twelve years as Vice President of Finance, Chief Financial Officer and Corporate Secretary of The Webb Company, a then NASDAQ listed Fortune 1000 printing and publishing company located in St. Paul, Minnesota.&#160; Mr. Carlson earned his Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration at the University of South Dakota, and received his Certified Public Accountant certificate in 1973.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Harold S. Carpenter:<font style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font></font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mr. Carpenter is the former President of Superiorgas Co., Des Moines, Iowa, which is engaged in the business of trading and brokering bulk refined petroleum products with gross sales of approximately $500 million per year.&#160; He is also the General Partner of Superiorgas L.P., an investment company affiliated with Superiorgas Co.&#160; Mr. Carpenter founded these companies in 1984 and 1980, respectively.&#160; Mr. Carpenter is also the President of Carpenter Investment Company, Des Moines, Iowa, which is a real estate investment company holding properties primarily in central Iowa.&#160; From 1970 until 1994, Mr. Carpenter was the Chairman of the George A. Rolfes Company of Boone, Iowa, which manufactured air pollution control equipment.&#160; Mr. Carpenter graduated from the University of Iowa in 1958 with a Bachelor of Science and Commerce degree.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">James T. Hecker:<font style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font></font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mr. Hecker is both an Attorney and a Certified Public Accountant.&#160; Since 1987 Mr. Hecker has been Vice President, Treasurer and General Counsel of Rhino Capital Incorporated, Evergreen, Colorado, a private capital management company which manages a $60 million portfolio.&#160; He also served, since 1992, as a trustee of an $11 million charitable trust.&#160; From 1984 to 1987, Mr. Hecker was the Controller of Northern Pump Company, Minneapolis, Minnesota, a multi-state operating oil and gas company with more than 300 properties, with responsibility of all accounting and reporting functions.&#160; Prior to that, from 1981 to 1984, Mr. Hecker was Audit Supervisor of Total Petroleum, Inc., Denver, responsible for all phases of internal audit and development of audit and systems controls.&#160; Mr. Hecker received a J.D. degree from the University of Denver in 1992, and a B.B.A. degree in Accounting and International Finance from the University of Wisconsin in 1979.&#160; He is a member in good standing of the Colorado and the American Bar Associations, the Colorado Society of CPAs, and the American Institute of CPAs.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Thomas C. LaVoy:<font style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font></font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Thomas C. LaVoy has served as Chief Executive Officer of IsoRay Medical since February 2016, a company for which Mr. LaVoy has served as a Director since 2005 and Chairman of the Board since January 2016.&#160; From July 1997 to January 2016, Mr. LaVoy served as Chief Financial Officer of SuperShuttle International, Inc., and as Secretary from March 1998 to January 2016.&#160; From September 1987 to February 1997, Mr. LaVoy served as Chief Financial Officer of NASDAQ-listed Photocomm, Inc.&#160; Mr. LaVoy was a Certified Public Accountant with the firm of KPMG Peat Marwick from 1980 to 1983.&#160; Mr. LaVoy has a Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting from St. Cloud University, Minnesota, and is a Certified Public Accountant.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Danielle L. Haney:<font style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font></font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Danielle L. Haney served as the Controller for various subsidiaries of the Company since September 2001.&#160; Starting in August 2007, Ms. Haney began serving as the Company's Corporate Controller and in March 2014 was appointed to the position of Chief Financial Officer.&#160; From August 1994 to August 2001, Ms. Haney </font>served in various accounting positions at Kyocera Solar, Inc. (formerly Photocomm, Inc.), most recently as the Controller.&#160; Ms. Haney has a Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting from Arizona State University.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">37</font></div>

<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt">&#160;</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On February 25, 2016, the Company's Board of Directors appointed Joshua Silverman to serve as a member of the Board of Directors until the next meeting of the Shareholders.&#160; Effective September 6, 2016, Mr. Silverman resigned his board membership noting the need to fulfill other professional obligations and confirmed there are no disagreements with the Company.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Joshua Silverman:&#160; </font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Joshua Silverman, 46, is the Co-founder and is a Principal and Managing Partner of Iroquois Capital Management, LLC, the Registered Investment Advisor to Iroquois Capital LP and Iroquois Capital (Offshore) Ltd.&#160; Mr. Silverman has served a Co-Chief Investment Officer of Iroquois since inception in 2003.&#160; From 2000 to 2003, Mr. Silverman served as Co-Chief Investment Officer of Vertical Ventures, LLC, a merchant bank.&#160; Prior to forming Iroquois, Mr. Silverman was a Director of Joele Frank, a boutique consulting firm specializing in mergers and acquisitions.&#160; Previously, Mr. Silverman served as Assistant Press Secretary to The President of the United States.&#160; Mr. Silverman received his B.A. from Lehigh University in 1992.</font></div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Non-Director Significant Employees</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company generally reports officers of its operating subsidiaries.&#160; However, there are no additional officers to report as the Company's CEO and CFO are the officers of its sole operating subsidiary.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Audit/Corporate Governance Committee</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Audit/Corporate Governance Committee of the Board of Directors is currently comprised of three independent directors, and operates under a written charter adopted by the Board.&#160; The Audit/Corporate Governance Committee Charter was included as Exhibit A in the Company's Definitive Proxy Statement filed with the SEC on October 18, 2004.&#160; The members of the Audit/Corporate Governance Committee are Harold S. Carpenter, a CEO with over 30 years senior management experience, James T. Hecker, an attorney and CPA, and Thomas C. LaVoy, a CPA.&#160; All three individuals are experienced in reading and understanding financial statements, and, in fact, are deemed to be financial experts as defined by audit committee requirements.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Audit/Corporate Governance Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the work of the independent registered public accounting firm engaged for the purpose of preparing an audit report or performing other audit, review or attest services for the Company.&#160; The auditor reports directly to the Audit/Corporate Governance Committee.&#160; The Audit/Corporate Governance Committee has established "whistleblower" procedures for the receipt, retention and treatment of complaints regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters, including procedures for the confidential anonymous submission by employees of the Company of concerns regarding questionable accounting or auditing matters.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Authority to engage independent counsel and other advisors has been given to the Audit/Corporate Governance Committee as it determines is necessary to carry out its duties.&#160; The Company provides appropriate funding for the Audit/Corporate Governance Committee to compensate the independent registered public accounting firm and any lawyers and advisors it employs and to fund ordinary administrative expenses of the Audit/Corporate Governance Committee that are necessary in carrying out its duties.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Audit/Corporate Governance Committee provides general oversight of the Company's financial reporting and disclosure practices, system of internal controls, and the Company's processes for monitoring compliance by the Company with Company policies.&#160; The Audit/Corporate Governance Committee reviews with the Company's independent registered public accounting firm the scope of the audit for the year, the results of the audit when completed, and the independent registered public accounting firm's fee for services performed.&#160; The Audit/Corporate Governance Committee also recommends the independent registered public accounting firm to the Board of Directors and reviews with management various matters related to its internal accounting controls.&#160; During the last fiscal year, there were three meetings of the Audit/Corporate Governance Committee.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Management is responsible for the Company's internal controls and the financial reporting process.&#160; The independent registered public accounting firm is responsible for performing an independent audit of the Company's consolidated financial statements in accordance with the auditing standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States) and issuing a report thereon.&#160; The Audit/Corporate Governance Committee is responsible for overseeing and monitoring the quality of the Company's accounting and auditing practices.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">38</font></div>

<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt">&#160;</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The members of the Audit/Corporate Governance Committee are not professionally engaged in the practice of auditing or accounting and may not be experts in the fields of accounting or auditing, or in determining auditor independence.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Compliance with Section 16(a) of Securities Exchange Act of 1934</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires the Company's Officers and Directors, and persons who own more than 10% of a registered class of the Company's equity securities, to file reports of ownership and changes in ownership with the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC").&#160; Officers, Directors and greater than 10% shareholders are required by SEC regulations to furnish the Company with copies of all Section 16(a) forms they file.&#160; Based solely upon a review of the copies of such forms furnished to the Company, or written representations that no Form 5's were required, the Company believes that as of the date of filing of this Form 10-K, all Section 16(a) filing requirements applicable to its officers, Directors and greater than 10% beneficial owners were satisfied.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Code of Ethics</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company has adopted a Corporate Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, which was included as Exhibit 99.2 in the Company's Form 10-Q filed with the SEC on November 15, 2004.&#160; We believe our code of ethics is reasonably designed to deter wrongdoing and promote honest and ethical conduct; provide full, fair, accurate, timely and understandable disclosure in public reports; comply with applicable laws; ensure prompt internal reporting of code violations; and provide accountability for adherence to the code.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Code of Business Conduct and Ethics is presented on the Company's web page under the subheading "Corporate Governance."&#160; Shareholders may receive a copy of the Company's adopted Code of Conduct, without charge, via e-mail request to <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">alanco@alanco.com</font>, by calling the Company at 480-607-1010, or by writing to the Company to the attention of the Company's Corporate Secretary at 7950 E. Acoma Drive, Suite 111, Scottsdale, Arizona 85260.</div>

<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">39</font></div>

<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>

<div id="DSPFPageHeader"></div>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</div>

<br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ITEM 11.&#160; EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Summary Compensation Table</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following table sets forth the compensation paid by the Company for the services rendered during the fiscal years ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 to the Company's Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer during the last fiscal year (collectively, the "Named Executive Officers").&#160; No stock appreciation rights ("SARs") have been granted by the Company to any of the Named Executive Officers during the last two fiscal years.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>

<tr>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>

</table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Option Grants in Last Fiscal Year</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There were no stock option grants during the fiscal year ending June 30, 2016.&#160; No stock appreciation rights ("SARs") have been granted by the Company.&#160; During the fiscal year ended June 30, 2016, 3,200 previously granted stock options expired or were cancelled.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Aggregated Options and Warrants</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 9.1pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 9.1pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">40</font></div>

<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Option Grants Subsequent to Fiscal Year End</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">No employee stock options were granted subsequent to 2016 fiscal year end.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Employment Agreements and Executive Compensation</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On June 30, 2014, the Company entered into employment agreements, effective July 1, 2014, with the Company's Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer.&#160; The employment agreements provide for levels of compensation and continuation of benefit under company benefit plans.&#160; The agreements have severance provisions and are effective until 18 months after notice of termination is given by either party.&#160; The employment agreements were filed via Form 8-K on July 1, 2014 and are incorporated by reference to this 10-K filing.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Compensation of Directors</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During fiscal year 2016, the Company added a fifth member to the Board of Directors.&#160; During fiscal 2016, the four continuing directors earned $12,000 in fees of which cash payments of $9,000 were paid during the year and $3,000 was accrued at June 30, 2016.&#160; The new director earned $4,000 in fees of which cash payments of $2,000 were paid during the year and $2,000 was accrued at June 30, 2016.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During fiscal year 2015, non-employee Directors were compensated for their services in cash for a total of $7,500 plus 25,000 stock grants for a total of 75,000 shares value at $31,500.&#160; The Company recorded $16,500 of expense related to the stock grants during fiscal year 2015 and had accrued $15,000 as of June 30, 2014.&#160; In addition, each independent director was granted 80,000 stock options during the fiscal year 2015.&#160; All Directors are entitled to receive reimbursement for all out-of-pocket expenses incurred for attendance at Board of Directors meetings.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Newly appointed Directors may receive options to purchase shares of common stock at fair market value.&#160; Upon each subsequent anniversary of the election to the Board of Directors, each non-employee Director may receive additional options to purchase shares of common stock at fair market value.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ITEM 12.&#160; SECURITY OWNERSHIP OF CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS AND MANAGEMENT</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Security Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following table sets forth certain information with respect to each shareholder known by Alanco to be the beneficial owner of more than 5% of the outstanding Alanco common stock or voting rights as of September 20, 2016.&#160; Information regarding the stock ownership of the Estate of Robert R. Kauffman, former Alanco Chairman and Chief Executive Officer and John A. Carlson, current Alanco Chairman and Chief Executive Officer is also shown in the table in the following section, Current Directors and Executive Officers.&#160; Exercisable stock options owned by the individuals listed below have exercise prices ranging from $0.50 to $0.75 per share.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">

The address of the principal office of each of the Reporting Persons is 641 Lexington Avenue, 26<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller">th</sup> Floor, New York, New York 10022. In February 2016, Joshua Silverman was named to the Board of Directors of the Company and Mr. Silverman resigned his board membership effective September 6, 2016.&#160;</td>

<br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Security Ownership of Management</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following table sets forth the number of exercisable stock options and the number of shares of the Company's Common Stock beneficially owned as of September 20, 2016, by individual directors and executive officers and by all directors and executive officers of the Company as a group.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The number of shares beneficially owned by each director or executive officer is determined under rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, and the information is not necessarily indicative of the beneficial ownership for any other purpose.&#160; Unless otherwise indicated, each person has sole investment and voting power (or shares such power with his or her spouse) with respect to the shares set forth in the following table.&#160; Exercisable stock options owned by the individuals listed below have exercise prices ranging from $0.50 to $0.75 per share.</div>

<tr style="HEIGHT: 18px">
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 2%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">&#160;</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" colspan="15">&#160;</td>
</tr>

<tr style="HEIGHT: 18px">
<td style="FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 2%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">&#160;(1)</td>
<td style="FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" colspan="15">Beneficial ownership is determined in accordance with the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") and generally indicates voting or investment power with respect to securities. In accordance with SEC rules, shares that may be acquired upon conversion or exercise of stock options, warrants or convertible securities which are currently exercisable or which become exercisable within 60 days are deemed beneficially owned. Except as indicated by footnote, and subject to community property laws where applicable, the persons or entities named in the table above have sole voting and investment power with respect to all shares of Common Stock shown as beneficially owned.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 2%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">&#160;(2)</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" colspan="14">COB is Chairman of the Board; CEO is Chief Executive Officer; EVP is Executive Vice President; CFO is Chief Financial Officer.</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 10%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">&#160;</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 2%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">&#160;(3)</td>
<td style="FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" colspan="15">Excludes 240,277 shares of Class A Common Stock owned by Rhino Fund LLLP. The fund is controlled by Rhino Capital Incorporated, for which Mr. Hecker serves as Treasurer and General Counsel. Mr. Hecker disclaims beneficial ownership of such shares.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 2%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">&#160;(4)</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" colspan="15">The percentages for Class A Common Stock shown are calculated based upon 4,982,400 shares of Class A Common Stock outstanding on September 20, 2016. The percentages for Total Voting Rights Percent of Class are calculated based upon 4,982,400 voting rights as of September 20, 2016.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 2%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">&#160;(5)</td>

All options listed that were issued to the executive officers and directors were exercisable at September 20, 2016.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 2%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">&#160;(6)</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" colspan="15">The number and percentages shown include the voting rights shares actually owned at September 20, 2016 and the shares of common stock that the identified person or group had a right to acquire within 60 days after September 20, 2016. The percentages shown are calculated based upon 4,982,400 voting rights as of September 20, 2016. In calculating the percentage of ownership, option shares are deemed to be outstanding for the purpose of computing the percentage of shares owned by such person, but are not deemed to be outstanding for the purpose of computing the percentage of shares owned by any other stockholders.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 2%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal">&#160;(7)</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" colspan="15">Per Schedule 13D filed with the SEC on May 7, 2014, Iroquois Capital Management, LLC with joint filers Iroquois Master Fund Ltd., Joshua Silverman and Richard Abbe are the owners of 474,398 shares of the Company's Class A Common Stock. In February 2016, Mr. Silverman was named to the Board of Directors of the Company and Mr. Silverman resigned his board membership effective September 6, 2016.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">43</font></div>

<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ITEM 13.&#160; CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS, AND DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Transactions with Related Persons</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">See Note 11 to the consolidated financial statements for related party transactions and discussion.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Director Independence</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Using the listing standards of Nasdaq and the SEC, the Company's Board of Directors has determined that Mr. Carpenter, Mr. Hecker, Mr. LaVoy and Mr. Silverman each qualify under such standards as an independent director.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ITEM 14.&#160; PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTANT FEES AND SERVICES</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Audit Fees</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The aggregate fees billed by Semple, Marchal &amp; Cooper, LLP for professional services rendered for the audit of the Company's annual financial statements and review of the&#160; Company's Annual Reports on Form 10-K and Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q, for the fiscal years ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 were approximately $81,300 and $81,400, respectively.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Audit Related Fees</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In fiscal year 2016, approximately $15,700 was billed for assurance related services rendered by the independent registered public accounting firm that are reasonably related to the performance of the audit or review of our financial statements and are not reported under the "Audit Fees" paragraph above.&#160; No such fees were billed in fiscal year 2015.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">All Other Fees</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Other than the services described above under "Audit Fees", during the fiscal years ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, Semple, Marchal &amp; Cooper, LLP did not provide tax or other services.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Audit Committee Pre-Approval Policies and Procedures</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The 2016 and 2015 audit services provided by Semple, Marchal &amp; Cooper, LLP were approved by our Audit/Corporate Governance Committee.&#160; The Audit/Corporate Governance Committee implemented pre-approval policies and procedures related to the provision of audit and non-audit services.&#160; Under these procedures, the Audit/Corporate Governance Committee pre-approves both the type of services to be provided by our independent registered public accounting firm and the estimated fees related to these services.&#160; During the approval process, the Audit/Corporate Governance Committee considers the impact of the types of services and related fees on the independence of the auditor.&#160; These services and fees must be deemed compatible with the maintenance of the auditor's independence, in compliance with the SEC rules and regulations.&#160; Throughout the year, the Audit/Corporate Governance Committee and, if necessary, the Board of Directors, reviews revisions to the estimates of audit and non-audit fees initially approved.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
</div>

<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">44</font></div>

<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">

</div>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">B.&#160;&#160; Schedules</font><font style="WIDTH: 252pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">NONE</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Exhibits or schedules other than those mentioned above are omitted because the conditions requiring their filing do not exist or because the required information is given in the financial statements, including the notes thereto.</div>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31.1
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>exhibit_31.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 31.1 CERTIFICATION
<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
<title></title>
<!--Licensed to: Alanco Technologies, Inc.
    Document created using EDGARfilings PROfile 4.0.0.0
    Copyright 1995 - 2016 Summit Financial Printing, LLC.  All rights reserved.-->
</head>
<body>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">EXHIBIT 31.1</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Certification of</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">President and Chief Executive Officer</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">of Alanco Technologies, Inc.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">I, John A. Carlson, certify that:</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">1.&#160; I have reviewed this quarterly report on Form 10-K of Alanco Technologies, Inc.;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">2.&#160; Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">3.&#160; Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">4.&#160; The registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">(a)&#160; Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">(b)</font><font style="WIDTH: 18pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">(c)&#160; Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">(d)&#160; Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">5.&#160; The registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">(a)&#160; All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">(b)&#160; Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Date:&#160; &#160; September 30, 2016</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>

<table style="WIDTH: 30%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id="62269513395f4c88820827f24e4b34ec" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 25%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">/s/ John A. Carlson</div>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 31_2 CERTIFICATION
<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
<title></title>
<!--Licensed to: Alanco Technologies, Inc.

    Copyright 1995 - 2016 Summit Financial Printing, LLC.  All rights reserved.-->
</head>
<body style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" bgcolor="#ffffff" text="#000000">
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">EXHIBIT 31.2</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Certification of</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Chief Financial Officer</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">of Alanco Technologies, Inc.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">I, Danielle L.&#160;Haney, certify that:</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">1.&#160; I have reviewed this quarterly report on Form 10-K of Alanco Technologies, Inc.;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">2.&#160; Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">3.&#160; Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">4.&#160; The registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">(a)&#160; Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">(b)</font><font style="WIDTH: 18pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">(c)&#160; Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">(d)&#160; Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">5.&#160; The registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">(a)&#160; All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">(b)&#160; Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting.</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">Date:&#160; &#160; September 30, 2016</div>

</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">CERTIFICATION OF CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">PURSUANT TO 18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">In connection with the quarterly report of Alanco Technologies, Inc. (the "Company") on Form 10-K for the period ending June 30, 2016, as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the "Report"), John A. Carlson, as President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company and Danielle L. Haney, as Chief Financial Officer of the Company, each hereby certifies, to the best of his/her knowledge, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>

<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id="a83d5399ebce4c9baafa45fb8a67c04c" class="DSPFListTable" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', serif; FONT-SIZE: 11pt">The Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<div style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt"><br style="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55pt">
</div>

<div>

    <us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Nature of Operations&lt;/b&gt; - Alanco&#13;Technologies, Inc. (OTC QB: ALAN) was incorporated in 1969 under the laws of the State of Arizona. Unless otherwise noted, the&#13;&amp;#34;Company&amp;#34; or &amp;#147;Alanco&amp;#148; refers to Alanco Technologies, Inc. and its wholly-owned subsidiaries. The Company&amp;#146;s&#13;subsidiary, Alanco Energy Services, Inc. (&amp;#147;AES&amp;#148;), operates a water disposal facility near Grand Junction, CO to receive&#13;and dispose of produced water generated as a byproduct from oil and natural gas production in Western Colorado.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 9pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/b&gt;&#13;&amp;#150; These consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted&#13;in the United States (GAAP). The consolidated financial statements for the years ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 include, where appropriate,&#13;the accounts of Alanco Technologies, Inc. and its wholly-owned subsidiaries, Alanco Energy Services, Inc. and StarTrak Systems,&#13;LLC (&amp;#147;StarTrak&amp;#148;) (collectively, the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;). Alanco is an Arizona corporation, Alanco Energy Services,&#13;Inc. is a Colorado corporation and StarTrak is a Delaware LLC. All significant intercompany accounts and transactions have been&#13;eliminated in consolidation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/b&gt; -&#13;The Company considers all highly liquid instruments with maturities of three months or less at the time of purchase to be cash&#13;equivalents.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150;&#13;The Company operates the Deer Creek water disposal facility near Grand Junction, CO and bills customers (primarily in the oil and&#13;gas industry) for produced water received. The Company generally recognizes revenue at the time the produced water is received&#13;at the Deer Creek facility and filtered. In addition, the Company generates revenue from oil reclamation and generally recognizes&#13;oil revenue when the oil is picked up by the customer. Water and related oil revenues can be impacted by weather conditions and&#13;the prices of oil and gas which may impact drilling activities. Revenue is generally recognized when all of the following have&#13;been met:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Courier New, Courier, Monospace; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 45pt; padding-left: -20pt"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 18pt; padding-left: -20pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: justify; padding-left: -20pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Persuasive evidence of&#13;an arrangement exists;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Courier New, Courier, Monospace; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 45pt; padding-left: -20pt"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 18pt; padding-left: -20pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: justify; padding-left: -20pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The service has been performed&#13;or product delivered;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Courier New, Courier, Monospace; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 45pt; padding-left: -20pt"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 18pt; padding-left: -20pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: justify; padding-left: -20pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The customer&amp;#146;s fee&#13;is deemed to be determinable and free of contingencies or significant uncertainties; and&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Courier New, Courier, Monospace; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 45pt; padding-left: -20pt"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 18pt; padding-left: -20pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: justify; padding-left: -20pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Collectability is probable.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 -40pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 -20pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 20pt"&gt;Any sales tax&#13;for which the Company is responsible is recorded as a reduction of the associated revenue.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 -20pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 20pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Accounts Receivable - Trade and&#13;Other&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The Company provides for potentially uncollectible trade accounts receivable and other receivables by use of&#13;the allowance method. An allowance for doubtful accounts is provided based upon a review of the individual accounts outstanding,&#13;the Company&amp;#146;s prior history of collections and the customer&amp;#146;s credit worthiness. The Company charges off uncollectible&#13;receivables when all reasonable collection efforts have been exhausted. The Company does not typically accrue interest or fees&#13;on past due amounts and the receivables are generally unsecured. The Company had no allowance for doubtful accounts receivable&#13;at June 30, 2016 and 2015 as all accounts receivable were deemed fully collectible.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Notes Receivable&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The&#13;Company provides for potentially uncollectible notes receivable by use of the allowance method. An allowance for uncollectible&#13;notes receivable is provided based upon a review of the individual notes outstanding and the ACC note holder&amp;#146;s credit worthiness.&#13;The Company charges off uncollectible notes receivable when all reasonable collection efforts have been exhausted. Interest income&#13;from notes receivable is recognized when earned as long as the amounts are deemed collectible and all interest payments are current.&#13;The allowance for doubtful notes receivable was $295,400 at June 30, 2016 and there was no reserve at June 30, 2015.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair Value of Assets and Liabilities&lt;/b&gt;&#13;&amp;#150; The estimated fair values for assets and liabilities are determined at discrete points in time based on relevant information.&#13;The ASC prioritizes inputs used in measuring fair value into a hierarchy of three levels: Level 1 &amp;#150; unadjusted quoted prices&#13;for identical assets or liabilities traded in active markets, Level 2 &amp;#150; observable inputs, other than quoted prices included&#13;within Level 1, such as quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities, quoted prices in markets that are not active or other&#13;inputs that are observable or can be corroborated by observable market data for substantially the full term of the asset or liability;&#13;and Level 3 &amp;#150; unobservable inputs in which little or no market activity exists that are significant to the fair value of&#13;the assets or liabilities, therefore requiring an entity to develop its own assumptions that market participants would use in pricing.&#13;These estimates involve uncertainties and cannot be determined with precision. The Company&amp;#146;s policy is to recognize transfers&#13;into and out of Level 1, 2 and 3 categories as of the date of the event or change in circumstances occurs.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The following are the classes of assets&#13;and liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis at June 30, 2016 and 2015, using quoted prices in active markets for&#13;identical assets (Level 1); significant other observable inputs (Level 2); and significant unobservable inputs (Level 3):&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="9" style="font-weight: bold; text-align: center"&gt;Fair Value at June 30, 2016&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13; width: 2%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 13%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; width: 2%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 15%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; width: 2%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 13%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font-style: italic; text-align: center"&gt;Level 1:&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;
