   &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: Black 0.5pt solid; text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;(4,000,000)&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="background-color: white"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Net operating loss and capital loss carryforwards&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; background-color: white"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;8,100,000&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;7,800,000&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="background-color: white"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Less: Valuation allowance&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="background-color: white"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: Black 0.5pt solid; text-align: right"&gt;(8,100,000)&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: Black 0.5pt solid; text-align: right"&gt;(7,800,000)&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="background-color: white"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="background-color: white"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="background-color: white"&gt;Net deferred tax&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; background-color: white"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: Black 2pt double; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;-&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-bottom: Black 2pt double; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;-&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;A valuation allowance is recognized&#13;if it is more likely than not that some or all of the deferred income tax assets will not be realized. A valuation allowance is&#13;used to offset the related income tax assets due to uncertainties of realizing the benefits of certain net operating loss and tax&#13;credits. The valuation allowance, which reflects a 100% reserve for all years reported above, increased $300,000 from June 30,&#13;2015 to June 30, 2016 primarily due to the expiration of state operating loss carryforwards. At June 30, 2016, the Company had&#13;net operating loss carry-forwards for federal tax purposes of approximately $34,900,000. The loss carry-forwards, unless utilized,&#13;will expire from 2018 through 2035. With few exceptions, the Company is no longer subject to U.S. federal, state and local examinations&#13;by tax authorities for years before 2011.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;Internal Revenue Code Section 382 limits&#13;the ability to utilize net operating losses if a 50% change in ownership occurs over a three year period. Such limitation of the&#13;net operating losses may have occurred which the Company has not fully analyzed at this time as the deferred tax asset is fully&#13;reserved, however, the Company has estimated a limitation effect on deferred tax assets of approximately $4 million at June 30,&#13;2016 and 2015.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;American Citizenship Center,&#13;LLC&amp;#160; &lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;At June 30, 2016 and 2015 the Company&#13;had a note due from American Citizenship Center, LLC (&amp;#147;ACC&amp;#148;), a related party, with gross balances of $295,400 and&#13;$322,800, respectively. At June 30, 2016, the Company fully reserved the note balance. Refer to Note 3 &amp;#150; Note Receivable&#13;&amp;#150; Related Party for further discussion.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;During the fiscal year 2016, the Company&#13;billed ACC a total of $29,100 which includes amounts for interest on the note and legal services. During the fiscal year 2015,&#13;the Company billed ACC a total of $46,300 which includes amounts for interest on the note, legal services related to note modifications&#13;and accounting services. At June 30, 2016, the Company had unpaid receivables from ACC in the amount of $2,800, consisting of $2,300&#13;representing one month of interest plus $500 of legal services. Subsequent to year end, ACC made payments bringing these balances&#13;current. At June 30, 2015, the Company had unpaid receivables from ACC in the amount of $4,200, consisting of $2,500 representing&#13;one month of interest plus $1,700 of legal services.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;u&gt;Board of Directors&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;During fiscal 2016, the Company added&#13;a fifth member to the Board of Directors. During fiscal 2016, each of the four continuing directors earned $12,000 in fees of which&#13;cash payments of $9,000 were paid during the year and $3,000 was accrued at June 30, 2016. The new director earned $4,000 in fees&#13;of which cash payments of $2,000 were paid during the year and $2,000 was accrued at June 30, 2016.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;During fiscal 2015, the Company made&#13;cash payments of $7,500 to each of the Company&amp;#146;s three independent members of the Board of Directors and issued each 25,000&#13;stock grants for a total of 75,000 shares valued at $31,500. The Company recorded $16,500 of expense related to the stock grants&#13;during the current fiscal year and had accrued $15,000 at June 30, 2014. In addition, each independent director received 80,000&#13;stock options during fiscal year 2015.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;As of June 30, 2016 and 2015, the Company&#13;had accrued deferred compensation of $58,400 and $5,300 respectively, payable to John Carlson, the Company&amp;#146;s Chief Executive&#13;Officer and a Director of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Employment agreements&lt;/b&gt; - On June&#13;30, 2014, the Company entered into employment agreements, effective July 1, 2014 with the Company&amp;#146;s Chief Executive and Chief&#13;Financial Officers. The employment agreements provide for levels of compensation and continuation of benefit under Company benefit&#13;plans. The agreements have severance provisions and are effective until 18 months after notice of termination is given by either&#13;party. Copies of the employment agreements were attached as exhibits to the Form 8-K filed on July 1, 2014.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 -40pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Leases &amp;#150; &lt;/b&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s&#13;corporate office is located at 7950 E. Acoma Drive, Suite 111, Scottsdale, Arizona 85260, in an approximately 1,500 square foot&#13;facility. At June 30, 2016 the facility was occupied on a month to month basis with monthly payments of $1,800 (including rental&#13;tax). Effective August 1, 2016, the month to month payment increased to $1,900 (including rental tax).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The ten year land lease related to&#13;Deer Creek, was effective May 1, 2012 and has two additional ten year option periods that may be activated by AES. The initial&#13;terms of the lease requires minimum monthly lease payments of $100 per acre (increasing to $150 and $200 per acre for the second&#13;and third ten year option periods, respectively) plus additional royalty payments based upon quantities of produced water received&#13;(approximately $0.25 per barrel) at the site. The design and construction of the Deer Creek water disposal facility required certain&#13;changes to the Goodwin Solid Waste facility resulting in extra costs to the landlord (owner of Goodwin Solid Waste). As incentive&#13;for the landlord to approve the facility design, AES agreed to limit landlord construction improvement costs related to the leased&#13;land to $200,000. Included in the $200,000 limited amount was $100,000 of landlord improvement costs to be paid by AES and reimbursed&#13;through a 50% credit against the $0.25 per barrel royalty payments due to the landlord. The prepaid royalty expired on August 31,&#13;2015 under terms of the agreement and therefore had a zero balance at June 30, 2016. Under certain circumstances, the acreage covered&#13;by the lease may be expanded by up to 50 acres to allow for additional expansion at the site.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;Rent expense for the fiscal years ended&#13;June 30, 2016 and 2015 were $60,500 and $53,300, respectively. Future minimum non-contingent payments as of June 30, 2016 are as&#13;follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="4" style="font-weight: bold; text-align: center"&gt;FUTURE MINIMUM PAYMENTS&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="4" style="font-weight: bold; border-bottom: Black 0.5pt solid; text-align: center"&gt;FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30,&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; width: 28%"&gt;2017&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; width: 28%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; width: 9%"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; width: 35%"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;28,600&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;2018&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;28,600&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;2019&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;28,600&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;2020&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;28,600&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; background-color: white"&gt;2021&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; background-color: white"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font-family: Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; background-color: white"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;28,600&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2" style="text-align: left; padding-left: 50pt"&gt;Thereafter&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;23,900&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2" style="text-align: center"&gt;TOTAL&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-top: Black 0.5pt solid; border-bottom: Black 2pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;166,900&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Legal Proceedings&lt;i&gt; &lt;/i&gt;&amp;#150;&#13;&lt;/b&gt;The Company is a defendant and counterclaimant in litigation involving its subsidiary, TSI Dissolution Corp. (formerly known&#13;as Alanco/TSI Prism, Inc.) (&amp;#147;TSI&amp;#148;) and the purchaser of TSI&amp;#146;s assets, Black Creek Integrated Systems Corp. (&amp;#147;Black&#13;Creek&amp;#148;). Black Creek filed a complaint in the Maricopa County Superior Court against TSI and the Company, being Civil Case&#13;No. CV2011-014175, claiming various offsets from the purchase price, primarily concerning inventory adjustments, and TSI counterclaimed&#13;for monies due from Black Creek under the purchase agreement. Following a trial during fiscal 2014, the court awarded a net judgment&#13;in favor of Black Creek in the amount of $16,800, plus attorney&amp;#146;s fees and accrued interest, resulting in a total judgment&#13;in the amount of $128,300. At June 30, 2014, the Company recorded an accrued liability of $128,300 for the judgment and had posted&#13;a bond with the court in conjunction with the Company&amp;#146;s appeal of the judgment. In May 2015, the State of Arizona Division&#13;One Court of Appeals vacated the trial court&amp;#146;s damages award and remanded to the trial court to direct the parties to follow&#13;dispute guidelines defined in the asset purchase agreement. In addition, the appellate court&amp;#146;s decision vacated the trial&#13;court&amp;#146;s attorney&amp;#146;s fees award and awarded TSI approximately $21,900 of its fees on appeal. At June 30, 2015, the Company&#13;reversed the accrual of $128,300 for the prior judgment. Under the court&amp;#146;s direction, the Company followed the dispute guidelines&#13;defined in the asset purchase agreement which resulted in an award to Black Creek of approximately $13,000. The Company has previously&#13;stipulated that it owed Black Creek approximately $9,600 for shared expenses incurred from 2010 - 2011. The court is currently&#13;reviewing Black Creek&amp;#146;s recent attorney&amp;#146;s fees application and the Company&amp;#146;s answer to said application. If the&#13;court were to grant a fee award to Black Creek, the range could be any amount from zero to the amount applied for, approximately&#13;$160,000. The Company vehemently disagrees with Black Creek&amp;#146;s attorney&amp;#146;s fees claim and believes that its legal defenses&#13;in its answer to Black Creek&amp;#146;s attorney&amp;#146;s fees application will preclude any award and accordingly the Company has&#13;not recorded a liability.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company may from time to time be&#13;involved in litigation arising from the normal course of business.&amp;#160; As of June 30, 2016, other than the litigation discussed&#13;above, there was no such litigation pending deemed material by the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Preferred Shares &lt;/b&gt;&amp;#150; the&#13;Company has 25,000,000 authorized no par shares of Preferred Stock of which 5,000,000 have been allocated to Series A, 500,000&#13;have been allocated to Series B, 400,000 have been allocated to Series C Junior Participating, 500,000 have been allocated to Series&#13;D, and 750,000 have been allocated to Series E. As of June 30, 2016 and 2015, no Preferred Stock of any series is issued or outstanding.&#13;The Board of Directors is authorized to issue preferred stock in one or more series and denominations and to fix the rights, preferences,&#13;privileges, and restrictions, including dividend, conversion, voting, redemption, liquidation rights or preferences, and the number&#13;of shares constituting any series and the designation of such series, without any further vote or action by our shareholders.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Common Shares&lt;/b&gt; - The authorized&#13;capital stock of the Company consists of 75,000,000 shares of no par Class A Common Stock, each entitled to one vote per share,&#13;and 25,000,000 shares of no par Class B Common Stock, each entitled to one-one hundredth (1/100th) of one vote per share. No Class&#13;B Common Stock has been issued and none was outstanding at June 30, 2016 and 2015.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;During fiscal year ended June 30, 2016,&#13;the Company did not issue any shares of Class A Common Stock. The value of stock-based compensation recognized during fiscal year&#13;ended June 30, 2016 was $27,800 and $1,100 was recognized for the value of exercisable detachable warrants issued with debt.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;During fiscal year ended June 30, 2015,&#13;the Company issued 75,000 shares of Class A Common Stock for services valued at $31,500. During the same period, the Company repurchased&#13;and retired 55,100 shares for $20,800 resulting in a 55,100 reduction in outstanding shares of Common Stock. The value of stock-based&#13;compensation recognized during fiscal year ended June 30, 2015 was $41,800.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;During the year ended June 30, 2015,&#13;the Company recognized a comprehensive income adjustment in the amount of ($121,200), reported in the Consolidated Statement of&#13;Changes in Shareholders&amp;#146; Equity. There was no comprehensive income adjustment during the fiscal year ended June 30, 2016&#13;since all marketable securities were sold in the prior year.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 12, 2011 the Company announced&#13;that its board of directors had authorized a stock repurchase program whereby the Company could repurchase up to 2 million shares&#13;of its outstanding common stock over the next 12 months. The stock repurchase program was extended several times and expired on&#13;December 31, 2015. For the year ended June 30, 2015, the Company had repurchases under the program for a total of 55,100 shares&#13;at a cost of approximately $20,800, or $0.38 per share.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CompensationAndEmployeeBenefitPlansTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company provides a 401(k) retirement&#13;plan for its employees. Employees are eligible to participate in the plan on the first of the month following 90 days of continuous&#13;employment. Employee salary deferral rates are not restricted by the Company, however, IRS limits and limitations imposed by discrimination&#13;tests may affect the allowed salary deferral rate. The Company&amp;#146;s 401(k) retirement plan has a Safe Harbor provision which&#13;requires all employees receive a 3% match based on gross wages. The Company&amp;#146;s matching contributions totaled $6,900 and $12,000&#13;for the years ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CompensationAndEmployeeBenefitPlansTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;During the fiscal years ended June&#13;30, 2016 and 2015, the Company reported a net loss of ($1,594,800) and ($900,600), respectively and operating loss of ($1,620,900)&#13;and ($1,173,800), respectively. Historically, the Company had relied on the liquidation of its investment in Marketable Securities&#13;to fund working capital needs. The Company sold all remaining marketable securities during fiscal 2015. These factors raise doubt&#13;about the Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue as a going concern for the next year. The Company&amp;#146;s fiscal 2017 operating plan&#13;includes divestiture of the undeveloped AES Indian Mesa site which is currently classified as Assets Held for Sale. Management&#13;cannot assure that the sale of Indian Mesa will be finalized which would provide additional cash flow to the Company. The Company&#13;is continuing to analyze options to monetize current and future operations of Deer Creek. There is no assurance that the Company&#13;will be able to execute options for Deer Creek. The Company announced it is entering the behavioral health market and the business&#13;plan includes the acquisition of behavioral health businesses which requires capital. There is no assurance the Company will be&#13;able to raise additional financing which may be in the form of public or private debt or equity financing, or both. If adequate&#13;funds are not available or are not available on acceptable terms, the Company&amp;#146;s business, operating results, financial condition&#13;and ability to continue operations may be materially adversely affected. Management has historically been successful in obtaining&#13;financing and has demonstrated the ability to implement a number of cost-cutting initiatives to reduce working capital needs. The&#13;accompanying consolidated financial statements have been prepared assuming the Company will continue to operate and do not include&#13;any adjustment that might be necessary if the Company is unable to continue as a going concern. As a result, the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;independent registered public accounting firm has included an explanatory paragraph in their audit opinion on the consolidated&#13;financial statements of the Company for the fiscal year ended June 30, 2016 discussing the substantial doubt of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;ability to continue as a going concern.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;Subsequent to June 30, 2016, ACC and&#13;the Company amended the loan agreement by requiring minimum monthly payments of $10,000 per month starting 60 days following implementation&#13;of an immigration reform program which allows DAPA or a similar program to be implemented in the United States. In addition, the&#13;maturity date was extended to August 31, 2018. All other terms of the note remained the same and all amounts payable were current.&#13;The ACC note receivable is fully reserved for as of June 30, 2016.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-weight: normal; font-style: normal; text-transform: none; letter-spacing: normal; word-spacing: 0px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255)"&gt;Subsequent&#13;to June 30, 2016, the Company formed Alanco Behavioral Health, Inc. (&amp;#147;ABH&amp;#148;), a wholly-owned subsidiary incorporated&#13;in the State of Arizona. The venture will be led by David C. Johnson, President. The Company launched ABH to pursue its business&#13;plan to consolidate small cap private behavioral health companies through acquisition. The Company&amp;#146;s objective is to create&#13;a market leader in behavioral health treatment services helping people and their families while adding value to the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;shareholders through strong revenue growth and cash flow. On September 23, 2016 the Company executed a Letter of Intent to purchase&#13;the operations of Bella Monte Recovery, LLC, its first acquisition in the behavioral health market.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;Subsequent to June 30, 2016, the Company&#13;received a board resignation notice from Joshua Silverman, effective immediately on the date thereof, September 6, 2016. Mr. Silverman&#13;noted the need to fulfill other professional obligations and confirmed there are no disagreements with the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;Subsequent to June 30, 2016, the Company&#13;drew an additional $200,000 from its line of credit with the Anderson Family Trust resulting in a current balance of $400,000 with&#13;$100,000 of remaining available credit.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ScheduleOfFairValueAssetsAndLiabilitiesMeasuredOnRecurringBasisTableTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 11pt Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Quoted Prices&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Level 2:&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center;     <us-gaap:NatureOfOperations contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Nature of Operations&lt;/b&gt; - Alanco&#13;Technologies, Inc. (OTC QB: ALAN) was incorporated in 1969 under the laws of the State of Arizona. Unless otherwise noted, the&#13;&amp;#34;Company&amp;#34; or &amp;#147;Alanco&amp;#148; refers to Alanco Technologies, Inc. and its wholly-owned subsidiaries. The Company&amp;#146;s&#13;subsidiary, Alanco Energy Services, Inc. (&amp;#147;AES&amp;#148;), operates a water disposal facility near Grand Junction, CO to receive&#13;and dispose of produced water generated as a byproduct from oil and natural gas production in Western Colorado.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:NatureOfOperations>
    <us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150;&#13;These consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United&#13;States (GAAP). The consolidated financial statements for the years ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 include, where appropriate, the&#13;accounts of Alanco Technologies, Inc. and its wholly-owned subsidiaries, Alanco Energy Services, Inc. and StarTrak Systems, LLC&#13;(&amp;#147;StarTrak&amp;#148;) (collectively, the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;). Alanco is an Arizona corporation, Alanco Energy Services, Inc.&#13;is a Colorado corporation and StarTrak is a Delaware LLC. All significant intercompany accounts and transactions have been eliminated&#13;in consolidation.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/b&gt; - The&#13;Company considers all highly liquid instruments with maturities of three months or less at the time of purchase to be cash equivalents.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:RevenueRecognitionPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The&#13;Company operates the Deer Creek water disposal facility near Grand Junction, CO and bills customers (primarily in the oil and gas&#13;industry) for produced water received. The Company generally recognizes revenue at the time the produced water is received at the&#13;Deer Creek facility and filtered. In addition, the Company generates revenue from oil reclamation and generally recognizes oil&#13;revenue when the oil is picked up by the customer. Water and related oil revenues can be impacted by weather conditions and the&#13;prices of oil and gas which may impact drilling activities. Revenue is generally recognized when all of the following have been&#13;met:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 60px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt/normal Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 60px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The service has been performed or product delivered;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt/normal Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 60px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The customer&amp;#146;s fee is deemed to be determinable and free of contingencies or significant uncertainties; and&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt/normal Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 60px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Collectability is probable.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 -20pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 20pt"&gt;Any sales tax for&#13;which the Company is responsible is recorded as a reduction of the associated revenue.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:RevenueRecognitionPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ReceivablesPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Accounts Receivable - Trade and Other&lt;/b&gt;&#13;&amp;#150; The Company provides for potentially uncollectible trade accounts receivable and other receivables by use of the allowance&#13;method. An allowance for doubtful accounts is provided based upon a review of the individual accounts outstanding, the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;prior history of collections and the customer&amp;#146;s credit worthiness. The Company charges off uncollectible receivables when&#13;all reasonable collection efforts have been exhausted. The Company does not typically accrue interest or fees on past due amounts&#13;and the receivables are generally unsecured. The Company had no allowance for doubtful accounts receivable at June 30, 2016 and&#13;2015 as all accounts receivable were deemed fully collectible.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ReceivablesPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:FinanceLoansAndLeasesReceivablePolicy contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Notes Receivable&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The Company&#13;provides for potentially uncollectible notes receivable by use of the allowance method. An allowance for uncollectible notes receivable&#13;is provided based upon a review of the individual notes outstanding and the ACC note holder&amp;#146;s credit worthiness. The Company&#13;charges off uncollectible notes receivable when all reasonable collection efforts have been exhausted. Interest income from notes&#13;receivable is recognized when earned as long as the amounts are deemed collectible and all interest payments are current. The allowance&#13;for doubtful notes receivable was $295,400 at June 30, 2016 and there was no reserve at June 30, 2015.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:FinanceLoansAndLeasesReceivablePolicy>
    <us-gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair Value of Assets and Liabilities&lt;/b&gt;&#13;&amp;#150; The estimated fair values for assets and liabilities are determined at discrete points in time based on relevant information.&#13;The ASC prioritizes inputs used in measuring fair value into a hierarchy of three levels: Level 1 &amp;#150; unadjusted quoted prices&#13;for identical assets or liabilities traded in active markets, Level 2 &amp;#150; observable inputs, other than quoted prices included&#13;within Level 1, such as quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities, quoted prices in markets that are not active or other&#13;inputs that are observable or can be corroborated by observable market data for substantially the full term of the asset or liability;&#13;and Level 3 &amp;#150; unobservable inputs in which little or no market activity exists that are significant to the fair value of&#13;the assets or liabilities, therefore requiring an entity to develop its own assumptions that market participants would use in pricing.&#13;These estimates involve uncertainties and cannot be determined with precision. The Company&amp;#146;s policy is to recognize transfers&#13;into and out of Level 1, 2 and 3 categories as of the date of the event or change in circumstances occurs.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The following are the classes of assets&#13;and liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis at June 30, 2016 and 2015, using quoted prices in active markets for&#13;identical assets (Level 1); significant other observable inputs (Level 2); and significant unobservable inputs (Level 3):&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 11pt Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 11pt Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;-&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;(528,100)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;(528,100)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2" style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Closing balance, June 30, 2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;$&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-top: black 1pt solid; border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;429,700&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;$&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-top: black 1pt solid; border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;653,900&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;$&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-top: black 1pt solid; border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;-&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;$&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-top: black 1pt solid; border-bottom: black 2.25pt double; text-align: right; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;1,083,600&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:AssetRetirementObligationsPolicy contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair Value of Asset Retirement&#13;Obligation&lt;/i&gt; &amp;#150; &lt;/b&gt;The Deer Creek asset retirement obligation is the estimated cost to close the Deer Creek facility under&#13;terms of the lease, meeting environmental and State of Colorado regulatory requirements. The estimate is determined at discrete&#13;points in time based upon significant unobservable inputs in which little or no market activity exists that is significant to the&#13;fair value of the liability, therefore requiring the Company to develop its own assumptions. Management&amp;#146;s estimate of the&#13;asset retirement obligation is based upon a cost estimate developed by a consultant knowledgeable of government closure requirements&#13;and costs incurred at similar water disposal facility operations. The process used was to identify each activity in the closure&#13;process, obtain vendor estimated costs, in current dollars, to perform the closure activity and accumulating the various vendor&#13;estimates to determine the asset retirement obligation. A present value discount has not been taken as the estimated closure costs,&#13;excluding regulatory changes and inflation adjustments, are anticipated to remain fairly consistent over the operational life of&#13;the facility. The lack of an active market to validate the estimated asset retirement obligation results in the fair value of asset&#13;retirement obligation to be a Level 3 fair value measurement. ASC Topic 410-20: Asset Retirement Obligations requires the Company&#13;to review the asset retirement obligation on a recurring basis and record changes in the period incurred.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:AssetRetirementObligationsPolicy>
    <us-gaap:ContingentLiabilityReserveEstimatePolicy contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair Value of Contingent Payments&#13;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&amp;#150; The contingent land payment liability is also determined at discrete points in time based upon unobservable inputs&#13;in which little or no market activity exists that is significant to the fair value of the liability, therefore requiring the Company&#13;to develop its own assumptions. In calculating the estimate of fair value for the contingent land payment, management completed&#13;an estimate of the present value of the contingent liability based upon projected income, cash flows and capital expenditures for&#13;the Deer Creek facility developed under plans currently approved by the Company&amp;#146;s board of directors. Different assumptions&#13;relative to the expansion or alternative uses of the Deer Creek and Indian Mesa facilities could result in significantly different&#13;valuations. The projected payments have been discounted at a rate of 3% per annum to determine net present value. The lack of an&#13;active market to validate the estimated contingent land liability results in the fair value of the contingent land liability to&#13;be a Level 3 fair value measurement. ASC Topic 820: Fair Value Measurement requires the Company to review the contingent land liability&#13;on a recurring basis and record changes in the period incurred.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ContingentLiabilityReserveEstimatePolicy>
    <us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/b&gt;&#13;&amp;#150; The Company&amp;#146;s financial instruments consist of cash and cash equivalents, accounts receivable, note receivable, trust&#13;account, accounts payable, accrued liabilities and note payable. The fair value of these financial instruments approximates their&#13;carrying values using Level 3 inputs, based on their short maturities or for long-term debt, based on borrowing rates currently&#13;available to us for loans with similar terms and maturities.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy>
    <us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Land, Property and Equipment&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150;&#13;Land, Property and Equipment are stated at cost. Depreciation is computed over the estimated useful lives of the assets using the&#13;straight-line method, generally over a 3 to 20 year period. Currently all office furniture and equipment are being depreciated&#13;over 3 years; production equipment over 7 to 10 years; and the water disposal facility over 15 to 20 years including 15 years for&#13;the evaporation pond liners and 20 years for the pond construction costs. Expenditures for ordinary maintenance and repairs are&#13;charged to expense as incurred while betterments or renewals are capitalized. Upon retirement or disposal of assets, the cost and&#13;accumulated depreciation are eliminated from the account and any gain or loss is reflected in the statement of operations.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentPolicyTextBlock>
    <ALAN:AssetsHeldForSalePolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Assets Held for Sale&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The&#13;Company has implemented a plan to divest its 160 acre owned and undeveloped land and associated permits located in Whitewater,&#13;Colorado and known as Indian Mesa. As a result, the cost of the land and associated permits has been reclassified as Assets Held&#13;for Sale at June 30, 2016. A long-lived asset classified as held for sale shall be measured at the lower of its carrying amount&#13;or fair value less cost to sell. The value of Assets Held for Sale represents the carrying amount.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</ALAN:AssetsHeldForSalePolicyTextBlock>
    <ALAN:TrustAccountAssetRetirementObligationPolicyTextblock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Trust Account &amp;#150; Asset Retirement&#13;Obligation&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The Company is required to make quarterly payments to a trust account for the closure costs of the Deer&#13;Creek facility. The Company reflects the gross amount of the trust as an asset and the gross amount of the estimated closure cost&#13;as a liability.&lt;/p&gt;</ALAN:TrustAccountAssetRetirementObligationPolicyTextblock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/b&gt; - The Company accounts&#13;for income taxes under the asset and liability method, which requires recognition of deferred tax assets and liabilities for the&#13;expected future tax consequences of events that have been included in the financial statements or tax returns. Under this method,&#13;deferred tax assets and liabilities are determined based on the difference between the financial statement basis and tax basis&#13;of assets and liabilities using enacted tax rates in effect for the year in which the differences are expected to reverse. To the&#13;extent that the Company does not consider it more likely than not that a future tax asset will be recovered, it provides a valuation&#13;allowance against the excess. If the Company had an income tax obligation and if any interest or penalties were assessed related&#13;to an underpayment, the Company would recognize the interest or penalty due by charging any penalty to other operating expense&#13;and any interest to interest expense in the period that they are assessed.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:UseOfEstimates contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/b&gt; - The preparation&#13;of the Company's consolidated financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States&#13;of America requires the Company's management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the amounts reported in these consolidated&#13;financial statements and accompanying notes. Actual results could differ from those estimates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company makes significant estimates&#13;and assumptions concerning the estimated fair value of stock-based compensation and detachable warrants, realization of deferred&#13;tax assets, collectability of accounts and note receivable, estimated useful lives and carrying values of fixed assets, the recorded&#13;values of accruals and contingencies including the Black Creek contingent liability and the estimated fair values of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;asset retirement obligation and the contingent land and purchase price liabilities, and the Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue&#13;as a going concern. Due to the uncertainties inherent in the estimation process and the significance of these items, it is at least&#13;reasonably possible that the estimates in connection with these items could be materially revised within the next year.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:UseOfEstimates>
    <us-gaap:ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsIncludingIntangibleAssetsPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/b&gt;&#13;- The Company&amp;#146;s policy is to perform an assessment for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that&#13;the carrying amount of a long-lived asset may not be recoverable. If the net carrying value of the asset exceeds estimated future&#13;undiscounted net cash flows, then an impairment is recognized to reduce the carrying value to the estimated fair value. No impairment&#13;charge was recorded in the fiscal year ended June 30, 2016.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsIncludingIntangibleAssetsPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income (Loss) Per Share&lt;/b&gt; - Basic&#13;income (loss) per share (EPS) is calculated by dividing the income or loss available to common shareholders by the weighted average&#13;number of common shares outstanding for the period. Diluted EPS reflects the potential dilution that could occur if securities&#13;or other contracts to issue common stock were exercised or converted into common stock. Basic and Diluted EPS were the same for&#13;fiscal 2016 and 2015, as the Company had net losses during both years and therefore the effect of all potential common stock equivalents&#13;is antidilutive (reduces loss per share).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company has a total of 1,340,000&#13;potentially dilutive securities outstanding at June 30, 2016 which includes stock options representing 1,200,000 shares of Class&#13;A Common Stock with exercise prices ranging between $0.50 and $0.75 and 140,000 outstanding stock warrants with exercise prices&#13;ranging between $0.50 and $1.00. At June 30, 2015, the Company had stock options representing 1,203,200 shares of Class A Common&#13;Stock outstanding at June 30, 2015 with exercise prices ranging between $0.50 and $1.50. There were no outstanding warrants as&#13;of June 30, 2015.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Courier New, Courier, Monospace; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationOptionAndIncentivePlansPolicy contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Stock Options Plans&lt;/b&gt; - The Company&#13;has stock-based compensation plans. The value of the compensation cost is amortized on a straight-line basis over the requisite&#13;service periods of the award (the option vesting term).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: -27pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company estimates the fair value&#13;of stock-based awards using the Black-Scholes valuation model. Assumptions used to estimate compensation expense are determined&#13;as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Expected term is determined under the simplified method using an average of the contractual term and vesting period of the award as appropriate statistical data required to properly estimate the expected term was not available;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 20pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Expected volatility of award grants made under the Company&amp;#146;s plans is measured using the historical daily changes in the market price of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock over the expected term of the award, and contemplation of future activity; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Risk-free interest rate is to approximate the implied yield on zero-coupon U.S. Treasury bonds with a remaining maturity equal to the expected term of the awards; and,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 20pt; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 24px; font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 11pt/107% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Forfeitures are based on the history of cancellations of awards granted by the Company and management&amp;#146;s analysis of potential forfeitures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;</us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationOptionAndIncentivePlansPolicy>
    <us-gaap:ConcentrationRiskCreditRisk contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Concentrations&lt;/b&gt; - The Company holds&#13;cash and cash equivalents in bank accounts that in some cases exceed the maximum FDIC insurance amount. At June 30, 2016 no balances&#13;exceeded FDIC insured limits.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Approximately 71.6% of AES revenues were&#13;generated by three customers during the fiscal year 2016 and all three customer accounts were current or paid in full as of June&#13;30, 2016. During fiscal year 2015, 85.1% of AES revenues were generated by four customers and all amounts billed to those customers&#13;were current or paid in full as of June 30, 2015. The significant customers represented $3,800, or 97.4% of the accounts receivable&#13;balance at June 30, 2016, while the significant customers for fiscal 2015 represented $14,900, or 32.4% of the accounts receivable&#13;balance at June 30, 2015.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ConcentrationRiskCreditRisk>
    <us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-07-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In May 2014, the FASB issued guidance&#13;regarding revenue from contracts with customers. The guidance outlines a single comprehensive model for entities to use in accounting&#13;for revenue arising from contracts with customers and supersedes the most current revenue recognition guidance. In August 2015,&#13;this accounting pronouncement was deferred for one year, and is effective for annual reporting periods beginning after December&#13;15, 2017, including interim reporting periods within that reporting period. Earlier application is permitted only as of reporting&#13;periods beginning after December 15, 2016. The Company is currently assessing the impact on its financial position and results&#13;of operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/normal Courier New, Courier, Monospace; margin: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In August 2015, the FASB issued guidance&#13;regarding the presentation and subsequent measurement of debt issuance costs for lines of credit. The guidance allows for the presentation&#13;of debt issuance costs related to line-of-credit agreements as an asset and subsequently amortizing the deferred costs ratably&#13;over the term of the line-of-credit arrangement. The guidance is effective for annual reporting periods beginning after December&#13;15, 2015 and early adoption is permitted. The Company has adopted the guidance, which had no material impact on its financial position&#13;and results of operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In January 2016, the FASB issued guidance&#13;regarding the enhancement of reporting financial instruments including aspects of recognition, measurement, presentation and disclosure.&#13;The guidance is effective for periods beginning after December 15, 2017 including interim periods within those fiscal years. While&#13;a portion of the guidance allows for early application, it does not permit complete early adoption. The Company is currently assessing&#13;the impact on its financial position and results of operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In February 2016, the FASB issued guidance&#13;regarding lease reporting. The guidance requires a lessee to record on the balance sheet the assets and liabilities for the rights&#13;and obligations created by leases with terms of more than 12 months. The guidance is effective for periods beginning after December&#13;15, 2018 including interim periods within those fiscal years and early adoption is permitted. The Company is currently assessing&#13;the impact on its financial position and results of operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In March 2016, the FASB issued guidance&#13;under the simplification initiative regarding stock compensation. The guidance is effective for annual periods beginning after&#13;December 15, 2016 and interim periods within those annual periods. Early adoption is permitted provided that all amendments are&#13;adopted in the same period. The Company is currently assessing the impact on its financial position and results of operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In June 2016, the FASB issued guidance&#13;regarding credit losses on financial instruments including loans. The guidance is effective for annual periods beginning after&#13;December 15, 2019 including interim periods within those annual periods. The Company is currently assessing the impact on its financial&#13;position and results of operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;There have been no other recent accounting&#13;pronouncements or changes in accounting pronouncements that are of significance, or potential significance, to us.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock>

<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>The end date of the period reflected on the cover page if a periodic report. For all other reports and registration statements containing historical data, it is the date up through which that historical data is presented.  If there is no historical data in the report, use the filing date. The format of the date is CCYY-MM-DD.</p></div>

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Indicate "Yes" or "No" whether registrants (1) have filed all reports required to be filed by Section 13 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 during the preceding 12 months (or for such shorter period that registrants were required to file such reports), and (2) have been subject to such filing requirements for the past 90 days. This information should be based on the registrant's current or most recent filing containing the related disclosure.</p></div>

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Indicate whether the registrant is one of the following: (1) Large Accelerated Filer, (2) Accelerated Filer, (3) Non-accelerated Filer, (4) Smaller Reporting Company (Non-accelerated) or (5) Smaller Reporting Accelerated Filer. Definitions of these categories are stated in Rule 12b-2 of the Exchange Act. This information should be based on the registrant's current or most recent filing containing the related disclosure.</p></div>

The public float should be reported on the cover page of the registrants form 10K.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AccountsPayableAndAccruedLiabilitiesCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred through that date and due within one year (or the operating cycle, if longer), including liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received, taxes, interest, rent and utilities, accrued salaries and bonuses, payroll taxes and fringe benefits.</p></div>

<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>For an unclassified balance sheet, the amount due from customers or clients for goods or services that have been delivered or sold in the normal course of business, reduced to their estimated net realizable fair value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain of collection.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AccountsReceivableNetCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Amount due from customers or clients, within one year of the balance sheet date (or the normal operating cycle, whichever is longer), for goods or services (including trade receivables) that have been delivered or sold in the normal course of business, reduced to the estimated net realizable fair value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain of collection.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-02.3-4)<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-122682<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher SEC<br> -Name Regulation S-X (SX)<br> -Number 210<br> -Section 02<br> -Paragraph 3<br> -Subparagraph a(1)<br> -Article 5<br><br>Reference 3: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher SEC<br> -Name Regulation S-X (SX)<br> -Number 210<br> -Section 02<br> -Paragraph 4<br> -Article 5<br></p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AccruedLiabilitiesCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered. Examples include taxes, interest, rent and utilities. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer).</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-02.20)<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-122682<br></p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ Details</a><div style="display: none;"><table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AssetRetirementObligation">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>The carrying amount of a liability for an asset retirement obligation. An asset retirement obligation is a legal obligation associated with the disposal or retirement of a tangible long-lived asset that results from the acquisition, construction or development, or the normal operations of a long-lived asset, except for certain obligations of lessees.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 410<br> -SubTopic 20<br> -Section 50<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (c)<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6392692&amp;loc=d3e7535-110849<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Glossary Asset Retirement Obligation<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6505190<br></p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.</p></div>
